District 90 has been striving to become a more equitable and inclusive learning community for years. But the stakes continue to rise as students and families of color in our midst continue to endure injustice and unfair circumstances in their lives. D90 invites all of our families to explain, define, and discuss the issues of race, injustice, and unfairness that our children continually see in the stories and images on TV and social media. To help with these discussions are two articles that provide insights and resources on how to hold those conversations with your children. District 90 is sharing these resources to assist our families and staff in supporting our children during these turbulent times. Please click the links below to view these resources:

https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/02/parenting/kids-books-racism-protest.html?referringSource=articleShare

https://digitaledition.chicagotribune.com/infinity/article_share.aspx?guid=7fc24123-47f2-48bb-924a-dc74c288eb7c

District 90 will now be extending our Remote Learning Days until April 30. To support our remote learning efforts, the District will be holding a “Virtual Teacher Institute Day” on Wednesday, April 1. The objective for this day is to provide additional professional development for our faculty members in the use of online teaching and conferencing tools. There will not be any E-Learning for students.

D90 invites you to participate in its “One District, Many Voices – A Storytelling Event” by sharing a story from your life. The theme for this event is “belonging.” With this topic, we invite you to explore issues around the concept of “belonging,” such as belonging to a community, belonging to a group, the meaning of belonging, yearning to belong, and other matters relating to the subject.

This Storytelling Event will be held on Wednesday, April 22, from 6:00 p.m. – 8:30 p.m. at Roosevelt Middle School. Interested individuals are invited to craft a 5-minute (maximum) true story related to “belonging” to share with the audience. Individuals who would prefer not to perform their stories publicly will also have the option to record their stories for our archives. D90 will even help you prepare with 2 coaching sessions. Interested? Simply fill out the participant survey: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf8GQrrM6esEFfyVHEfRlvYEKmepjjKX0uV4Ooh08mk8ZMQnw/viewform

The results from the 2019 Illinois School Report Cards are out. District 90 students continue to demonstrate strong academic performance. The overall scores for the District indicate that 69 percent of students met or exceeded proficiency in English/Language Arts (ELA), 63 percent met or exceeded proficiency in math, and 80 percent of middle school students are met or exceeded proficiency in science. The results also indicate that there are opportunities for growth, especially with specific groups of students and in the realm of math. All three District schools were rated as "Commendable" in the summary designations.

Please visit the District website to view the entire report card and to garner additional information: https://www.illinoisreportcard.com/District.aspx?source=profile&Districtid=06016090002

Individuals with a bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited institution can apply for a substitute license through the state and the Regional Office of Education. For additional information about substitute licenses go to the Illinois State Board of Education at https://www.isbe.net/pages/educator-licensure-requirements.aspx. Interested applicants should complete the District’s online application at www.district90.org. Please do not send documents to District 90.

District 90 has received an upgraded and improved bond rating from Moody’s Investor Services. The rating for the District’s general obligation limited tax debt (GOLT) has been upgraded from Aa2 to Aa1. The revised Aa1 rating reflects Moody’s opinion that obligations are “of high quality and subject to very low credit risk.”

The strong credit rating is the result of several factors including the District’s strong financial operations and reserves that are based on robust fund balances and liquidity with little exposure to Illinois’ pension funding challenges; Limited debt and pension burdens with no plans for future debt obligations; and forward looking financial planning combined with a moderate institutional framework.

Please click the link to read the press release that provides additional details about the recent bond rating upgrade -- http://www.district90.org/about/documents/MoodysUpgradePressRls.FINAL.073117.pdf

River Forest and District 90 officials will dedicate an art deco bas-relief panel that was previously displayed above a Washington School entryway. The panel has been recently relocated to the District's grounds. Please join us in celebrating the importance that this school played in the Village for many years!

There’s still time to register for Summer School in District 90. Summer School classes are designed to enable students to explore their personal interests as they learn new skills, as well as enhance social and emotional skills. Fourth grade students who’ll be moving into fifth grade can take a Roosevelt Readiness class.

All Summer School classes will be held at Willard Elementary and Roosevelt Middle Schools. Please be sure to visit District 90’s website -- http://www.district90.org/about/summer-school.cfm -- for registration and course information. Summer School starts June 15 and ends July 14, with no school on July 4.

post_text: Please consider participating in the Inclusiveness Advisory Board’s (IAB) 2017 Inclusiveness Perception Survey. The IAB is conducting this survey in order to monitor the degree in which District 90 fosters an environment of inclusion for students, staff, and families. The information will be exceptionally valuable as District 90 works to improve how we meet the needs of all stakeholders, particularly our students and families. This initial Inclusiveness Survey was conducted in 2015 and provided crucial information to the District on how welcomed and included families feel in our schools. The 2017 IAB survey will enable the District to monitor its progress and make needed adjustments to its procedures and practices. To participate in the 2017 Inclusiveness Survey, please go the link: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/7KS3L8H. The survey closes on March 22.
